website_summaries.verdict: So long as you don't expect the most powerful noise-canceling, the QuietControl 30 works really well as an everyday headphone. You can use it at the gym or for running.
pros: The Bose QuietControl 30 is well-built, very comfortable to wear, offers variable noise-canceling and excellent sound quality for a Bluetooth headphone
It's also sweat-resistant and can be used as a sports headphone
cons: Noise-canceling isn't as effective as QuietComfort 20 or QuietComfort 35
No wired option to plug into airline entertainment systems

website_summaries.verdict: The Bose QuietControl 30 earphones combine Bluetooth connectivity and effective ambient mics with industry-leading noise cancellation technology.
pros: Solid audio performance with rich bass and crisp highs
Ambient mics allow you to monitor your surroundings
cons: Neckband design is not for everyone

customer_reviews.title: Not for taking phone calls in loud environments
customer_reviews.text: Listening to music is great, and the noise cancelling is awesome. However, should you want to make a phone call, the microphone is of such terrible quality as to be mostly unusable. If you ever try to take a phone call in a crowded place such as an airport, the other party will be completely unable to hear you. When using these to place a phone call, it is worse than a cheap $10 Chinese headset. Works great other than talking on the phone, but I would've expected better from Bose.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: WARRANTY FRAUD ALERT!!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: WARRANTY FRAUD ALERT!! Warranty Exchange #1: Product fell apart after the first 8 months of use. Did a warranty exchange and waited nearly two months for the replacement. Warranty Exchange #2: Warranty exchange short-circuited within 1 week of receipt. That was two months ago, I have yet to receive the replqcement. Out of the last 13 months, I’ve spent 4 (and counting) waiting for Bose warranty replacements. This product is defective and so is the brand Bose for creating such a terrible manufacturer’s warranty intentionally designed to force customers into buying new products after their crummy design fails within a year.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bersch

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for market - design flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Not ready for market. The electronic noise cancelling works OK but the microphone is terrible, its so bad you cant have a conversation on the phone without the other party complaining. This is a known problem and is even well documented on BOSE web site. I suspect someone in upper management decided to put a product on the market that was not ready yet. Returned these for the Quiet Comfort 20 which work awesome, even on my motorcycle!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: After several months my headphones no longer work. They seem to constantly connect and disconnect. All my other wireless headphones work fine, so I know something is broken with the Bose headphones. I was hoping to send them back to Bose for an exchange, but after 6 emails I am getting nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: Flex

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Now on my second set, first one would not charge and now the second one charges it seems, but lasts 1 hour at the most. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Defective materials
customer_reviews.text: While it worked sound and app: exceptional but .. After using this summer on the beach, I noticed that the coefficient of expansion of the rubber and the plastic are different (the rubber stretched more than the plastic), which meant that I could not turn it on with the power button. And now the equipment stopped charging the batter (red light on). A pity, nothing to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ENRIQUE S.

customer_reviews.title: If you are having issues, call BOSE and have them replace them.
customer_reviews.text: 1/13/2020 - I really wanted to use these again for noise cancelling in the office, but they stopped charging completely. I called BOSE today and they are sending a replacement set. I love excellent customer service! The sound was amazing.... in the beginning, then, the headphone started peeling away from the protective case....Very dissapointing...sent back to BOSE, they send another set, same issue! I'm going to continue sending them back! For this kind of money I'd expect to get a few years of use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and not good for conference calls.
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling earpiece is good. Terrible for conference calls since the microphone is picks up ok everything sound around you. It is unreliable, my first unit battery just stopped taking a charge and I had it replaced. I am working my second replacement. If you want something reliable, find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the headphones are great..
customer_reviews.text: So, the headphones are great ... BUT (yeah, a big BUT) ... The rubber of the end comes off, dont know why,
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Andres Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Started out good
customer_reviews.text: While this product was fairly decent when I first got it, it has rapidly deteriorated due to low quality construction over the 2 years I have owned it. The outer cover is falling apart and it is almost impossible to turn the headset off now. Given that this product is stored inside of its case when ever it isn't around my neck the rapid quality loss is pretty disappointing. I expected better from Bose. Before it fell apart the noise cancellation in conjunction with music playing at a fairly low volume was very effective. Sound quality is decent and usability is pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Dean D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most about these is the battery life is great. They are comfortable to wear. The collar hides under my shirt. YMMV Quick to connect to Bluetooth devices. Excellent nose build quality. —- What I don’t like Noise cancelling doesn’t work very well for me. I used to own the “big cans” model. Better noise cancelling but (ahem) a bit outdated and geeky these days. The carrying case. I like to travel light. Too big for me. Again YMMV. —- If you are an Apple user you will be delighted with the airpods.
customer_reviews.author: Harry F. Myhre

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in February. I've worn them occasionally since then - Bass started sounding raspy after 2-3 months, volume control and FWD/BK button stopped working properly about a month ago. Considering the price these should have been outstanding for a long time. They were for about 3 weeks. Now they're a $300 error sitting on my dresser mocking my inability to research and buy a pair of Sennheiser ear phones first.
customer_reviews.author: AC Griffin

customer_reviews.title: These are great...until they die. (Bose is about to ship me my 3rd pair.)
customer_reviews.text: I find these to fit comfortably in my ears, to have great sound, and to cancel sound quite well. The problem? The pair I bought in 2017 died after less than a year (symptom: turns off consistently within about a minute, even when fully charged). After discussion with support, they sent me a brand new pair...which died the same way after about six months. Yesterday, my THIRD pair died in the exact same way (having lasted a full year). They'll ship me my 4th pair soon...but I'll be without earphones for ~2 weeks again, and have to again deal with the hassle of mailing these back in. I'm shocked to have this happen three times in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peeling rubber - failed unit
customer_reviews.text: With less than a year of use, the neck piece rubber began to separate, then peeled. The on-off button no longer works and the headphones are no longer functional. At this price point I expected a more durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: It failed after manufacturer's warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: had it for little over a year. over course manufacturer's warranty expired and it died. not heavy use, just listening to pc and tv Bluetooth function. my biggest complaint beside failure of the equipment after 16 months is the charging cable. who was in charge of ergonomics when it comes to charging cable? they need to be fired. the charging cable is so short it is struggle to charge this device. I can't believe that BOSE came up this particular cable - why so short? every device I have from phone to laptop has lengthy cable but BOSE afford to give the customer longer cable? I will not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RokRanger1989

customer_reviews.title: 99.999% chance of being broken inside 6-12 months
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a total of 4 of these. Each and every done died in less than a year, most didn't even make 6 months. This has been a problem for these since they came out, yet Bose doesn't care in the slightest as evidenced by the fact they keep distributing garbage. It's a cash grab like Apple, a scam to make you buy more and more. Yet Bose gets away with it. It's really sad. Under no circumstances would I ever, ever, ever buy another pair. I'm ashamed I bought 4 to begin with, but there aren't any real competitors in the sound quality and comfort department.
customer_reviews.author: Sekaidragon

customer_reviews.title: Blocks out annoying co-workers
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This really works. I could turn my Apple headphones up all the way and still hear annoying chatterbox Co-workers. Wearing this is like being in total isolation....(which I typically prefer to be somewhat cognizant of what’s going on around me in case I miss a funny joke or entertaining phone conversation near me) but the chatterbox was sucking my last will to live and I raced to buy this while counting down the hours for Amazon prime shipping to arrive. Now he no longer works here. Oh well- I can use when I need to charge my phone. (Since Apple only has a single port for charging and headphones, this Bluetooth saves the day.) #realworldproblems
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connections is so inconsistent I have $20 head phones that out perform BOSE?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great, noise cancellation is pretty good but the connection failure rate is absurd! I've had $20 headphones could connect to my iPhone and MacBook and never miss a beat. I could get in my truck, bluetooth would switch seamlessly back and forth from cheap headphones to the truck with no issue. These things are absolutely infuriating! Every time I go from MacBook to iPhone I have "forget device" and reinstall them. If I get out of range sometimes the same thing happens again and I have to reinstall. This is not acceptable for the price you pay for these earbuds!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hagmeier

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but battery seems to go down fast and noise cancelling defaults to ON
customer_reviews.text: I have the wired ones for this product and it works just as well, although I'm not sure why they have slider to turn on noise cancellation, since I am ok with it being an ON-OFF switch as it is in the wired version. My only main qualm is that it turns on the noise cancellation to FULL everytime you turn it on, which uses more batter so oftentime I have to turn it off to avoid wasting battery life - it seems to use quite a bit more battery with it on than. After a few weeks the battery charge holds less than at the beginning a few weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: newreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming. Too much static
customer_reviews.text: Initially i thought it was my phone because the connection has too much static. It was connected to a Samsung Note So i paired with another phone (an Iphone this time) and the static is still there. And you cannot even walk away from the phone without losing connectivity. it has to be within a foot to work well. Totally beats the purpose when i cannot even walk away to another room when on a call. I love Bose products and expected the same quality i see in their other products this headphone's performance is disappointing and underwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Murang'a's Finest

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: Bought them used on Amazon. They seemed practically new. I was disappointed that the original box did not come with them. The ear tips were a little confusing. The bigger ones work better where I thought the little ones were more appropriate for me. I was wrong. I wanted them to walk with but still be able to hear the traffic. The sound is perfect and I love them. Haven't used them on a plane yet. I only wish there was an adaptor for airplane use. I will still have to carry my Bose QC 20s. Good thing they are tiny!!
customer_reviews.author: judith leclerc

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is Great, but riding in a vehicle? Telephone Talk? Hearer's cannot hear me well
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is better than my "Beats II" that I wore out. "Beats II seem to be no longer available. The battery life seems to be 33% better than the Beats II. Having long battery life is very helpful! Sound quality? I have two different vehicles, a Toyota Tacoma (2015) and a Lexus RX350 (2007). Phone sound when I am in either of the vehicles seems to be an issue. When I am on the phone, the other party says it sounds like I am underwater, (obviously I'm not), it sounds like it's raining ( it's not), it sounds like it's windy, (it's not).. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 months old and the left earbud quit working.
customer_reviews.text: 4 months old and the left earbud quit working. I made it a point to treat these gently and they where only used a couple hours a day a few days a week when I take lunchtime walks. Also on that note, these are horrible if its windy outside, as the noise cancellation almost has the opposite effect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fulps

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless earphones! I purchased these to co-exist with my QC35 headphones and I also own a pair of QC20 as well. The wireless aspect of these earphones are why I bought them, so a I could have something lighter than the bulky QC35; to be fair, the QC35 are the best at canceling all the noise, but these are lighter and sound great. I am watching my daughter swim at a swim meet tonight and with my music playing, they block all the nose; with the musics stopped, I can hear the louder sounds. I will update my review after I fly with these; that will be next week.
customer_reviews.author: Grant G.

customer_reviews.title: ... a little to get used to but otherwise really good sound and amazing active noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: Collar took a little to get used to but otherwise really good sound and amazing active noise canceling. Do your research on what noise canceling means - they will NOT block all sound but they weren't designed to. I bought them for riding on my motorcycle and they stay put and do wonders reducing road noise without blocking out car horns and other 'important' sounds. waited a long time to spend this type of money on a set of buds but it was definitely worth the wait. love them!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I do wish the cord was retractable
customer_reviews.text: I have several bose products. These are great. I do wish the cord was retractable, but hanging is ok. I use on the plane and in the office. I have the bose over the ear too, but like these better. After a while, the over the ear gets uncomfortable. The QC 30 last me all day plus. I never run out of battery. One issue I do have, when on a conference call, people say they hear my typing and it is annoying. That might be because I usually leave one earpiece out hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They are good, not 100% effective at noise canceling
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is great and it is extremely comfortable in the ear - have owned Bose headphones before and expected this. Noise canceling works well for low pitched noises - it’s good for work when I want to drown out office chatter, but I found on an airplane high pitched (i.e squealy baby noises) come through, even at max noise reduction setting. Had to turn the audio volume up to help drown it out. My husband has the Bose over ear ones and they block out the world - just not comfortable on me.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had any problems with these so far. ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with these so far. I use them mostly for conference calls while mobile throughout the day. I'm guessing my pair came after the microphone updates people believe happened because I haven't had any issues with people hearing me. I agree with most complaints about wishing you could keep some of the noice cancelling on while on the phone or at least revert to the last level of noice cancelling after a call is ended, but that being software I'm hoping they update that.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas E. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: POOR BUILD QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: For a top of the line product for a reputable company like Bose, the build quality is beyond poor, I bought one earlier this year and had to return it because of red light issue and the peeling of the rubber. Got a second pair as a gift 3 months in the rubber starts peeling, and not just peeling but peeling and stretching. It cant even be glued because there is so much rubber hanging, i don't know how they manage to have that about of overhang. Very disappointed with customer service as well, I really expected far better for a $300.00 pair of earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: good for non-active use, indoors, not very tall people
customer_reviews.text: sitting down, working or something like that, in an office environment, these seem potentially very useful. the noise cancellation for background mechanical noise is very good. i got these to cut down on wind and traffic noise during outdoor activities. they seem to amplify wind noise. i'm also pretty tall, and the length of the wires between the neck and earbuds are short enough that it was constantly pulling the buds out of position (or out). i already have the over-ear versions, so I didn't need these for office/work and returned them. these probably cancel noise slightly better than the older wired over-ear ones.
customer_reviews.author: kC

customer_reviews.title: 150$ too expensive not worth the bad quality these need more R&D
customer_reviews.text: I liked the adjustable noise cancellation in my shop and it is handy for answering call between two phones, it will announce the saved contact name or read off the number calling and is also compatible with Siri. Battery life was excellent however I purchased a set of skull candy method wireless that are far mor reliable way better sound quality and have a 9 hour battery life for functionality I prefer the cheap 50$ headphones
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Connelly

customer_reviews.title: they are pretty useless.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are really unclear and run to only three pages. I purchased the headphones to have noise cancellation while trying to sleep on planes. I detected no discernible difference in noise levels with the headphones in or out, or with the level of noise reduction high or low. After a long and unproductive call with Bose tech support, was told that the noise cancellation only works when listening to music through the headphones. If true, they are pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Webb

customer_reviews.title: Like the QC20 but wireless
customer_reviews.text: I've had the QC20 prior to getting these QC30 and it seems to me that the noise-cancellation and sound quality is pretty similar. The battery life is pretty good lasting over 10 hours with no problems. The charge time is pretty quick taking under 1 hour to fully charge from 0. Bluetooth is usually really solid, but had some occasional issues that was solved by getting closer to the source. I don't use the mic much but the mic sound quality isn't very good, given the increased distance compared to the QC20. Overall, very satisfied. Real life saver on airplanes, buses, and next to heavy snorers (add in some white noise and the snoring goes away).
customer_reviews.author: userx

customer_reviews.title: I love them. Great sound. Noise cancellation work very well.
customer_reviews.text: I have the over the ear noise canceling headphone. Bought these because I cannot wear a hat with the others. I think the sound is just as good; once you get them set up. First use there was a lot of intermittent micropauses as the firmware was updating over Bluetooth and seemed to be taking forever. I connect to my computer via USB to do the update. Sounds great. The power/pairing/mode button is a bit finicky. They are quite comfortable. I am in love. I will retire the over the ear ones to home duty.
customer_reviews.author: BraveBear

customer_reviews.title: WIRES NEED TO BE LONGER
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine -- both sound quality and noise suppression seem to me comparable to the wired ear buds from Bose that I have been using for several years. But there's one design feature that keeps me from giving these a five. The wires on the ear buds really need to be longer. These seem designed for people with very short necks. I am a man of average build, and I find it really hard to use the controls because of the short wires. I also agree with other reviewers that you should be able to plug in an audio cord so that you could use these with airline entertainment systems etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nello

customer_reviews.title: It was all great until one day one side started to have statics
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bose headphone for two weeks. Everything was great in terms of sound quality and comfort level until one day I fell asleep with the headphone and waking up by a noisy static sound on one side of the headphone. The static sound wouldn't go away no mater how I adjust the headphone. It's really bugging me and I have no choice but to return it. I really wanted it to work, it's definitely the best headphone i've ever owned. However there's no way anyone can stand the static noise coming from it.
customer_reviews.author: 99 Review

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: Breaks incredibly easy.....get insurance. Also the noise canceling has a life of about a year. Just fyi.....otherwise nice headphones just too expensive to malfunction like they do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance and product support
customer_reviews.text: Every claim Bose makes about these earphones is true. Not only that, after using these nearly every day for 4 years, the rubber cover on the neck ring began to separate and the power switch couldn't be used. I called Bose directly to see what I could do to remedy the problem. Without hesitation, because this was an unusual failure, they replaced the earphones with a brand new one. They were not obligated to do that as the one year warranty expired long ago. Quality product from a quality company. I can't say enough good things about Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Kruml

customer_reviews.title: Design could be better
customer_reviews.text: I am a Bose enthusiast and have owned many of their headsets including those for aviation. Unfortunately I did not get the "wow" feeling from these. For the portability, the sound is good and noise canceling is good. I guess I expected something more like the LG tone where you could wear these around your neck when you're not using them. Maybe I'm missing something but the cords are just supposed to dangle when not in use?
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Must have for college students!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these headphones! I study at Starbucks and the library anywhere from 30-50 hours a week while in Nurse Practitioner graduate school. These headphones do a phenomenal job at canceling out most background noises. With the addition of classical music I can study for many hours pretty much anywhere without issues. Hopefully they come out with noise cancelling wireless earbuds soon!!
customer_reviews.author: ChrisRN87

customer_reviews.title: rather get Bose QC 20 than QC 30
customer_reviews.text: I own the QC 20 and tried QC 30. 20 is my recommendation for earphones (as wired). Though newer, the QC 20s offer a little more noise cancelling than the QC 30s. Also, while both headphones need a charge to do their noise cancelling magic, the QC 20s will at least work as headphones when their battery dies. The QC 30s do not.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: The app for adjusting the noise cancellation level is good. My previous pair of Bose headphones were all or nothing. I use them on planes & in the airport when traveling, as well as in the office on business calls. The only thing I don't like is the cover over the charging port...I'm waiting to see if it lasts, or comes off. I'm also curious to see if I have the issue down the road - that others reported, where the rubber started to separate. But for me - these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stamatina

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of these headphones and they are terrific. I use them around the shop with wood working tools and they dampen the ambient noise of drills and saws. I use them in the car and they reduce the road noise almost completely. I will buy another pair after this pair wear out. Battery life is about 10 hours of constant use (audiobook) or longer for intermittent use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Bose no longer stands for quality
customer_reviews.text: CQ 30 headphones disintegrated barely holding together after only 1 year. No longer holds a full charge and turns off and on by itself!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Becker

customer_reviews.title: What did you say? NC is excellent
customer_reviews.text: My son has used these and highly recommended them so I bought these for my BF who is the hardest person to buy gifts for, and my BF said I hit a homerun! Everything works awesome. He is really impressed by the noise canceling, the sound is great, and its light weight on the neck. I have been using Bose IE Sport buds for years and new the sound quality would be great and no worries about the ear buds falling out or causing hot spots in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: I have had my headphones a little over one year. I love the noise cancelling, but the entire rubberized cover on the collar has come apart. I literally have to reach under the detached cover to access the micro switch itself to turn them off and on. A search of the Bose website indicates this is not an uncommon problem. Very disappointed that Bose would allow a product with an obvious manufacturing defect make it to the market.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Duggins

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancelling Works! Great music sound too.
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GRACIOUS GOODNESS. I work in a fairly quiet office, but the people in the offices next door and down the hall are LOUD and never close their doors. These things are magic. They are perfect for blocking out extraneous noise while I listen to music instead of someone else's fifth conference call of the day. Also, unlike some other bluetooth headphones I have owned, you really can adjust the volume in increments. It's not CONCERT or WHISPER. There are actual levels of sound you can control right on the earbuds or with the app on your phone.
customer_reviews.author: L. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great for sedentary environments, long battery life and great sound quality control
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for two years, and I have been very happy with it so far. They are best for using in an open office space when you want to block out distractions, and the battery lasts the entire working day. Sedentary environments are the best situations to use this headset; I wouldn’t recommend this to use during physical activity like running or dancing because the neck band would simply move around too much. For physical activities I would use the earbuds, but for the office I love using QC30.
customer_reviews.author: meimei

customer_reviews.title: "UPDATE"--It fails quickly and Bose refuses to help because it was purchased through Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: The Bose QuietControl 30 worked great for about two months. Then it started to have problems. It would loose the bluetooth connection for no reason. Just a click and it's gone. Now they don't work at all and Bose support is none existent. $300.00 down the drain. UPDATE--The Bose store at Opry Mills exchanged the defective headset for a new one. The new one has been excellent. Good sound, good noise reduction, long battery life. It redeemed the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph P.

customer_reviews.title: Just of working out...not for all day use...
customer_reviews.text: Decent for working out and great sound quality; however, the design is horrible. There are no magnetic connections so the ear buds flop around, the neck band has no balance, so it's constantly unbalanced and I am constantly re-adjusting it. Unlike the Samsung Level, the Bose QC 30 looks unprofessional in business attire. And lastly, the Bose QC 30 headphones does not maintain connections for phone calls and when it does connect, the party on the other line complains about background noise. I have reverted back to my Samsung Level headphones for business and only use the Bose when working out.
customer_reviews.author: steve_2013

customer_reviews.title: for bikers
customer_reviews.text: i ride a motorcycle and have loud aftermarket pipes i have been buying headphones for years and always finding something i didn't like. they would fall out, get caught up in helmet, hurt my ears, battery wouldn't last and many more. Within minutes of wearing these i knew i had found a better product. these r pricey and when not in your ears they just kinda dangle around and that's all the negative i can say. by far, they are the most comfortable, best sounding, best noise canceling set i have ever owned! if you ride, this is the pair for you. music is loud and pipes just purr in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Heitz

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're getting before you buy - great WIRELESS headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great noise cancellation for the platform - you're not going to get the same as you would with the over-the-ear style, but that's the sacrifice for this form factor. I am a little critical of the reviews that complain there's no jack to connect to airplane audio. I researched the product before I bought it and knew it doesn't work with headphone jacks. But why would you want it to? You're buying "wireless" headphones! Great product, a little pricey compared to competition, and a nice little app to tweak the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had them for a week so far but love them best earbuds ever the battery last all day I work 12 hours a day and still have 30% battery life left I listen to pod cast continues and I can hear when I have a text or email thru them great product i work in a stamping plant and it blocks out 20 presses stamping steel I’ve bought many earbuds and these are the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B

customer_reviews.title: 6 month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: 6 months after I bought this, one side of the headphone failed. Bose warranty people were great to work with, and promptly replaced it with a brand new one. 6 months later, that replacement unit failed. During those 6 months, I liked the product - sound quality and noise cancelling is great. Battery life is ok, not as long other headphones. But my low rating is for the lifespan. I felt like at this price point, it should last a bit longer than 6 months before it fails.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Child

customer_reviews.title: The QC 30 falls to pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the QC 30, liked it a lot. Excellent sound, excellent noise cancellation. But after three months it began to fall apart. The neck component just went to pieces until eventually the control buttons didn't even work. Bose replaced the unit immediately. Great. Three months later the same thing happened with my new one. This time Bose offered me a free upgrade to the over-ear QC 35 II. They HAVE to know the QC 30 is crap. Look at the reviews—you know they do! Why are they still selling this junk?
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Pagaard

customer_reviews.title: Good for long flights and train rides
customer_reviews.text: Good for long flights and train rides, but makes me feel like I need to "pop" my ears as if on a fast high rise elevator. The noise cancelling is a little weird and I can't seem to quite get used to it. Purchased the non-noise cancelling Sports model and like them much better, but will save the QuietControl for travel. Battery life is great - about 10 hours. Wish I could plug in an external cable though to use with airplanes headrest entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: SG in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 uses.. not an exaggeration!
customer_reviews.text: I have literally used these 8 times. And even though they connected to my phone, the noise cancelling function and SOUND stopped working. I cannot believe Bose would put out such a poor piece of equipment. And it’s EXPENSIVE too.
customer_reviews.author: Missy M

customer_reviews.title: UnBose like features defeated the purpose...
customer_reviews.text: One of the rarest occasions that I had rated a Bose product with 2 stars. Didnt like that the headphones dangle out all the time (and do not retract). The noise cancellation isnt too great. While on calls, folks on the phone have complained that the TV voice is now being heard clearly when I switched out from a plain 'headset' to this headphone. And this defeated the whole purpose of having Boise headphones- it is supposed to cancel external sounds through its microphone too and not cancel noise.
customer_reviews.author: Anil G

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these headphones that my husband hasn’t bought. He listens to music with them when he’s at work, nothing more. But this is also the second time that they have fallen apart. Very disappointing in a pair of headphones that are not inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good but product quality is very poor. This is not what expected from the company like Bose. As you can see from the pictures, the rubber covering stretches and comes off due to regular use. Check online for others who have the same problem, they are much worse. Another annoying part of the headphone is the earpiece has no place to park when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: maw442

customer_reviews.title: CONTROL BUTTONS DOES NOT WORK AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: THE BUTTONS DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. I have an iPhone 6 and an iPhone 8 plus. I tried to connect both devices with these headphones, it just could not work. The buttons weren't able to adjust volume, take calls, or even skip/pause/play songs. The neck band though, was quite comfortable compared with the Sony wi-1000x's neck band. Plus, Bose's StayHear tips has always been one of my favorite features. I loved Bose's wired QC 20 noise cancelling earphone, but the QC 30 earphones' noise cancelling sound quality is significantly lower than the wired version. I have to say I am more than disappointed with this fact AND the control buttons malfunction situation.
customer_reviews.author: Aangel

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancelling earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: My commute to work is almost 4 hours on the train 5 days a week. There are so many annoying people on trains talking entire time of 2 hours each way or feel like they have to scream on the train to talk to someone next to them. Thank God for this Bose Noise Cancelling earbuds... these block out all noise! Amazing! I don’t want to blast music in my ears... I would like to protect my hearings to block out those inconsiderate fellow commuters. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lee

customer_reviews.title: Only complaint is the battery life
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation is great. Only complaint is the battery life. I have conference calls all day and by 4pm my neckband headphone is out and I need to go back to my LG, which lasts for days. Cannot justify the high cost, I would not buy Bose again.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Rubber layer on neck band came off, button unusable!
customer_reviews.text: I did really like this product initially as the sound quality was great (except for making calls, which functionality I honestly don't use often) but after some time it started breaking apart, the rubber cover on the neck band came off and then the on/bluetooth button became inoperable. As owner of several Bose products used to top quality craftsmanship, I have to give this one a full thumbs down given the excessively expensive price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Painter C

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of materials, one ear is not working after a 1.5 year of use.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers mentioned, silicon/rubber coating on the ends of the neck piece started to detach and bulge approximately 6 moths after the purchase. Then, a few days ago, one of the ears stopped producing sound. This is after a year and a half of use. Not OK for a $300 headphones. Will submit a warranty claim to return/replace. Otherwise the sound quality is good, noise cancelling is OK for white noise (very good for the airplane), but very poor for human speech, and other higher frequency noise.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Hunk of junk
customer_reviews.text: 1) My first pair started playing static. After much hassle, they finally sent me a new pair. So far, no issues with that. I'm very, very delicate with my headphones. 2) The "noise cancellation" is actually "noise amplification" for the people on the other end of the line. It's terrible and they have offered NO results or solutions. This was a SUPER expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished....right...
customer_reviews.text: I'm just going to start off mentioning that I have a hearing impairment starting off. The faulty product I received started making high pitched sounds and crackling noise so loud I actually had to rip them out of my ears. If you have normal hearing, dont recommend this because it will give you lawsuit worthy hearing damage. I'm not exaggerating. I realize how it sounds. This is more of a warning than a review.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Allen

customer_reviews.title: These are the best headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphone to help limit noise overwhelm ( I am Autistic). I have found them to be so helpful. They are small enough that carrying them around all the time is easy and they don't take up mach space. I recently took them to Disneyland with me and the people and performers from the nightly parade didn't bother me at all. I could hear a little noise when I wasn't playing music but as soon as I played music, even quietly, I couldn't hear anything.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki

customer_reviews.title: The Absolute Best Blue Tooth Noise Canceling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely great, comfortable, no complaints. Of course all the sound snobs are going to complain about audio quality, these sound great with music and talk. While the noise cancelation may not be as good as the wired versions, i'm completely happy with the wireless trade off. I will be keeping my wired ones for airplanes though. I did NOT get these for free in exchange for a review.
customer_reviews.author: DrDreMM

customer_reviews.title: Truly Excellent Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have never taken the time to review many products but I was really impressed with these headphones. I use this for trips and casual music listening. These are extremely comfortable. Amazing sound. Easily connected. Battery easily charged and case keeps it safe from harm during travel. Truly amazing product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus E. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Bose quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Failed within one year. Great sound when it worked. Don’t bother with square trade, as they are no help and did not want to honor the four year plan I paid for. Finally did replace them. They failed within a year again. Again having to fight with the warranty company.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Love this sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound coming out of these is so good. I use them on airplanes to listen to my music and it drowns out the noise. The app is easy to use and helpful. I also use them when my husband watches his TV when we are travelling in hotels and I want to read. I love them. But then what's not to love about Bose products. My husband bought a pair for me for Christmas without my knowing and I bought him a pair for Christmas! Cool.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: These things worked great for the music, they block out all the outside noise, but don't buy them if you want to use them for phone calls. The microphone picks up all the background noise and the person you're talking to gets very annoyed with how loud it is.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Awful Quality. Poor Materials; Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: After trying numerous noise canceling headphones and earbuds these are by far the best audio and noise canceling. However, I’d expect these to last a few years given the high price point. Sadly after about 18 months they had to be trashed. Similar to many other’s reviews, the plastic on the neck band separated and the product becomes unusable. Once the case breaks apart you can’t turn the headphones on or off. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Are they real Bose?
customer_reviews.text: I only use them for about a week carefully, the charging pot cover lid is already hard to close. Also, it has several white dots on it. The overall material just doesn't match the name!!! Comparing with my friend's QC30 which has been using for more than a year bought in a store, mine looks like the older one. Really doubt the authentication and manufacture. Wondering whether should I return it....
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Bao

customer_reviews.title: Good battery. Bad everything else.
customer_reviews.text: Good battery. Bad everything else. I've owned these for about 5 months and I simply can't believe how awful they are. They are simply the WORST! Low volume sound, terrible microphone, excruciatingly poor connectivity. They are completely unusable if the phone is in my back pocket. What's that; like 20" away? Unbelievable. I own several sets of Bose noise cancelling headphones and earbuds. They are all well made and provide great performance. These are not those headphones. Do yourself a favor and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: These wireless earbuds have surprisingly good noise cancelling. It took a couple of trys to connect to my television usind a. blue tooth adaptor, but finally connected and no problems. I like to use them sometimes when walking my dog when traffic is high. It cancels out pretty good for earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: OK headphones, awful Bluetooth implementation
customer_reviews.text: These are fine. Decent sound, decent noise cancelling. The big let down is in the area of Bluetooth support where the product is flat out annoying to use. It can only be paired with two devices at a time. And this is controlled through a poorly-implemented app that sometimes works, sometimes crashes, and always needs to be started at least twice to find the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES L

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Failed within one month: they don't charge and don't power on.
customer_reviews.author: Odin@FF

customer_reviews.title: Good basic headphones
customer_reviews.text: They work great. Sound great and I've had no problems with battery. Wish they would remember the level of noise canceling that they were set at when I turn them off and wish I could use them to control my audio, next track and previous track. Otherwise they're awesome.
customer_reviews.author: melka

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise cancellation!
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation on these are so good it’s kind of eerie! I plan to use them for airline travel but have been using them on the treadmill. I can barely hear my feet hitting the treadmill. And sound quality is exceptional as is the case with other Bose headphones. The neck piece hasn’t bothered me much so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Follow-up on my dead headset.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved these but 13 months later they are dead. Red light, not charging. Contacted BOSE via text message. Asked if they could do anything or was I out of luck being 1 month past warranty date. The response was swift and 2 weeks later there was a brand new headset on my porch free of charge. That's the kind of service that keeps me coming back. Thanks BOSE.
customer_reviews.author: Spitfire

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging after one and a half year
customer_reviews.text: Stopped charging after one and a half year - I'm glad I purchased an insurance. Mic is not good - ppl were complaining while I was talking to them. Noise Cancelling is good.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Bose Quietcontrol 30 Headset
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new Bose headset. I did have trouble pairing it with my new Microsoft Surface Pro tablet. Had to set the headset as the default playback to work. Worked immediately with my iPhone. Doesn't seem to hold a charge as long as I thought it would. I have not actually measured it yet. Nice case and the ear plugs fit well. 3 sizes included in package. Noise cancelling works well.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Left earbud will fail in time.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid these headphones. The left earbud will begin to pop and crackle based on a design flaw in the hardware. It may take a year or two, but it will happen. Check the Bose community site or search “Bose QC30 left ear crackle” and you’ll see what I mean. $300 is too expensive to deal with garbage engineering like this.
customer_reviews.author: James Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: Bose 20
customer_reviews.text: Price was nice.....day three of excesses use (three + hours per day) sound is great (white noise when not being used), Noise cancellation not as great as Bose 35, comfortable as the Bose Sports.....YES I own four Bose (Bose Soundtouch)
customer_reviews.author: Pangster

customer_reviews.title: I love Bose products since 20 yrs
customer_reviews.text: But after using Bose quiet control 30 for 6 months the cover start go out even I not use it in sport I try many time to put special glue for it because I can't return to USA for warrantees , first time buy Bose product with this quality
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMMED H ALI AHMED

customer_reviews.title: A working life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a very noisy environment and these along with ambient sounds clears everything away. They are totally worth every penny. At first I thought they would feel weird in my ears but they don't. They are the most comfortable ear buds I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Maxi

customer_reviews.title: Great sound & battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I ride my motorcycle - and it’s not a quiet bike - even if I’m riding without a helmet the sound is great and the ear pieces do not not fall out. I like these so much I bought a second one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Mathews

customer_reviews.title: NC pretty good, but around 6 months soft plastic began ...
customer_reviews.text: NC pretty good, but around 6 months soft plastic began separating from hard plastic, and today (unit is only 9 months old) they became totally unusable with a red light trying to recharge and no button response (suspect battery failure)
customer_reviews.author: Pete Isburgh

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is not as good on an airplane as my older wired in-ear bose ...
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation is not as good on an airplane as my older wired in-ear bose model - but otherwise great. Battery is good for about 6+ hrs of noise cancellation + listening to music or watching movies, but again not as good as my older wired model.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerGeek

customer_reviews.title: Left ear started to crackle after about 10-11 months
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed to say that my headphones are not working like I thought they would. After about 10 months the left ear started to crackle all the time. It is very annoying because even if I don't have it in my ear I hear it. I am pretty frustrated by this
customer_reviews.author: Joan McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for noise cancelling. I wear it when I study. Of course. the sound of quality is also very good. It can connect both phone and PC, very convenient, and the audio source switch automatically. very very convenient. I used to wear ear plugs for noise canceling, but wearing ear plugs is not that comfortable. Just a little expensive.
customer_reviews.author: P Chen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in January hoping to finally find a great wireless Bluetooth ear bud. The noise cancelling was sort of OK, even when setting it to the max using the iPhone app. I had regular complaints about the voice sound quality. And to make a bad situation worse, they would not hold a charge as of the first of this month, so there was basically 6 months of product life. Not at all acceptable for the price.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Lewin

customer_reviews.title: I also don't like when in coming calls are announced and the voice ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headphone thinking that by paying a high price you get quality. I'm looking for a headset with noise cancelation. My callers can not hear me if there is some noise around me. It's not what I expected. I also don't like when in coming calls are announced and the voice one my current call is blocked. That is the only reason I purchased so my customer can hear me clear with out noise interruption when other coworkers are load on the back ground. After 10 months of use the head sets do not charge at all.
customer_reviews.author: JUAN CARLOS ORELLANA

customer_reviews.title: Noise Canceling Amazing - But Beware of this fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love Bose headsets. I thought a wireless one would offer even greater flexibility. The noise canceling is phenomenal. However, when using it as a headset for phone calls, the reason I bought it, it is abysmal. I usually do not make the effort to return things, but for $300 I did because I was so disappointed. If using this for only listening to music, it is ideal. Otherwise I suggest a different option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality excellent. Noise cancellation good for my frequent airline travels
customer_reviews.text: Have used for 3 trips. Sound quality excellent. Noise cancellation good for my frequent airline travels. Although I'm getting used to it, I'm not a fan of the neck piece which does not stay evenly positioned around neck. I'm still getting used to the position of controls on the neck piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headache for your investment.
customer_reviews.text: I dont like not because of the price but because of the quality and frequent disconnect with your mobile or laptops. I dont want to go through pains after spending $320.
customer_reviews.author: AKD22

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones when running. I like the fact that they attach to a neck strap so I don't have to hold them when I take them out and that they stay in my ears securely. It started raining the other day and they were not damaged by the water, although I certainly wouldn't go swimming in them! Microphone and call sound quality is also excellent. I'm a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ellena Hogrefe

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling is good. Just needs an input so you can use ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Noise cancelling is good. Just needs an input so you can use it on a plane. I ended up buying a small Bluetooth transmitter that I plugged it to the plane socket and that worked. However, it adds another thing you need to take with you on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B.

product_meta.title: Bose Quietcontrol 30 Wireless Headphones, Noise Cancelling - Black
product_meta.description: Listen like never before with quiet control 30 wireless headphones. Decide how much of the world you want to let in, or how quiet you want your surroundings to be, with adjustable noise cancellation. While you're listening to your favorite music, volume optimized EQ delivers balanced audio performance no matter the volume. And a noise rejecting dual microphone system helps reduce the noise around you to deliver clearer calls. Bluetooth and NFC pairing let you connect to your devices quickly and conveniently, so you can listen to a podcast on the train or music at work. With a lightweight neckband that gently conforms to your body and soft, comfortable stay hear+ qc tips, you can listen all day. A rechargeable lithium ion battery keeps going for up to 10 hours of wireless listening per charge. And a quick 15 minute charge will give you another Hour of use. The Bose connect app helps you manage your paired devices and gives you enhanced control. Available in Black. Included: quiet control 30 wireless headphones; 3 sizes of stay hear+ qc tips; USB charging cable; carrying case with accessory pouch.
feature_bullets: Breakthrough technology lets you control your own level of noise cancellation throughout your day
Bluetooth and NFC pairing so you can connect to your devices wirelessly. Bluetooth range: 10 m
Noise rejecting dual microphone system helps reduce the noise around you to deliver clearer calls
Lightweight neckband design conforms to your body for all day comfort and wear ability
Lithium ion battery lets you enjoy up to 10 hours of wireless listening per charge
Headphones dimension :6 H x 6.5 W x 0.75 L inches; Case dimension :6.5 H x 6.75 W x 1.4 L inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,297 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
